definitions.definition: A capacity to do something well; a technique , an ability , usually acquired or learned, as opposed to abilities that are regarded as innate .
examples: Where did you pick up that skill ?
With great skill , she navigated through the tricky passage.
Doing that coaching course not only taught me useful skills on the field, but also some important life skills .

definitions.definition: Display of art; exercise of ability; contrivance; address.

main_definition: A capacity to do something well; a technique , an ability , usually acquired or learned, as opposed to abilities that are regarded as innate .
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) Discrimination; judgment; propriety; reason; cause.
( obsolete ) Display of art; exercise of ability; contrivance; address.
